page.title: 04SPROTBROUGH LIBRARY
page.content: We were shown around by Mr.Mackay, a fully qualified Librarian. Born in 1952,went to college for a degree,then qualified. He hasn't had any other occupation.To become a Librarian you have to have good marks in your exams. Mr.Mackay showed us around first we went upstairs. There were newspapers and magazines for people to read, tables and chairs for us to do our homework There were old reference books which are not to be borrowed unless you need them badly.We looked at the Record and Tape section.You have to be fourteen to join. Not many people came in whilst we were there. The library is busiest on a Saturday because children are not at School.Three people work there on a Saturday.The Library is a quiet place and has been open for twelve years.
